instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2936: What is 820-2936? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U6100: What is U6100? this is an SPI ROM chip that holds the BIOS which is necessary for the machine to POST or try and power on..
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.ISL6259: What is ISL6259? This is a charging chip for Macbook motherboards from 2010 through 2015.
definitions.SMC_RESET: What is SMC_RESET? SMC_RESET is not a signal, it is an abbreviation for “SMC_RESET_L”, which is the signal someone is referring to when they type “SMC_RESET”  "SMC_RESET_L is a signal that resets the SMC when it is low(this is what the “_L” prefix means), and lets the SMC out of reset mode when it is high. .
definitions.U7000: What is U7000? U7000 refers to the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging IC on Macbooks from 2008-2012.
definitions.820-2565: What is 820-2565? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.SMC_RESET_L: What is SMC_RESET_L? SMC_RESET_L puts the SMC into reset mode when it is low, _L means the signal is present when voltage is low. The SMC being in reset mode keeps it from running..
definitions.SMC_BC_ACOK: What is SMC_BC_ACOK? This is identical to CHGR_ACOK. This will come out of the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging chip when CHGR_ACIN & CHGR_DCIN are present, and is necessary for the onewire circuit to begin working. On most Macbooks, CHGR_ACOK needs to be present in order for PP3V42_G3H to flow to the onewire circuit so that the circuitry that allows the charger to communicate with the SMC will turn on.  .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B Does not turn on
threads.message:
Magsafe connector does not turn on the led, but i have 3.46V in <CAPACITOR>C5710</CAPACITOR>;  in <CHIP>U6100</CHIP>  pins 3 and 8 i have 0V, in <CHIP>U7200</CHIP> pin 16 (VIN) i have 0.28V. I think i should have 12V instead that 0.28V.
When i take resistences to gnd in pin16 in the same <CHIP>U7200</CHIP> it is ok. 
What should i measure next?

threads.message: Was there corrosion around the <CHIP>ISL6259</CHIP>? Is ACOK present from 6259? <SIGNAL>SMC_RESET</SIGNAL> present?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B Does not turn on
threads.message:
Corrosion I have not seen yet on the motherboard, But if anything on Magsafe Dc In Jack Power Board Cable <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2565</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a I see signs of corrosion and a burnt transistor.
I have tried with another Magsafe Dc In Jack Power Board Cable <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2565</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a.
Do you mean <SIGNAL>SMC_BC_ACOK</SIGNAL> pin 14? Not present.
Do you mean <SIGNAL>SMC_RESET_L</SIGNAL> i did the measurement on <RESISTOR>R7000</RESISTOR> pin 1 3.42v.
<CHIP>U7000</CHIP> pin 19 VDD 5.03v.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B Does not turn on
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B Does not turn on
threads.message: That magsafe board is trash, use a known good one. Voltages on 6259 pin 2 and 3? Resistance to GND on PPBUS?
